title: Chaotic recruiting and 'harsh' decisions: Bill Belichick's first nine months at UNC
content: From enlightening and exhilarating to chaotic and tumultuous, there hasn't been anything boring about Belichick at UNC.

title: Rams expect Stafford to start Sunday vs. Texans
content: Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford, who missed time with an aggravated disk in his back, is expected to start the season opener against the Texans.

title: FSU freshman shot, in critical but stable condition
content: Florida State freshman linebacker Ethan Pritchard is hospitalized in critical but stable condition after suffering a gunshot wound Sunday night in Havana, Florida.

title: Sources: Parsons may get back injection to play
content: Packers pass rusher Micah Parsons has been dealing with an L4/L5 facet joint sprain in his back and he may receive an injection before Sunday's game against the Detroit Lions if needed to help him play, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Fictitious ending? Story fly hits glove, pole for HR
content: Boston's Trevor Story had a strange Fenway Park homer in the sixth inning against Cleveland when the ball went off an outfielder's glove and then the Pesky Pole.

title: Soto hits grand slam, triple to spark Mets in win
content: Juan Soto tied his career high with six RBIs, hitting a grand slam and a tiebreaking, two-run triple to lead the Mets over the Tigers.

title: Osaka ousts Gauff at US Open, returns to quarters
content: Naomi Osaka eliminated Coco Gauff 6-3, 6-2 at the US Open on Monday to reach her first major quarterfinal since 2021.

title: Venus, Fernandez keep rolling into doubles final 8
content: Venus Williams and Leylah Fernandez reached the women's doubles quarterfinals at the US Open, defeating the 12th-seeded duo of Ekaterina Alexandrova and Zhang Shuai 6-3, 6-4 in their third-round match Monday.

title: NBA free agent Payton starts skateboard league
content: NBA free agent Gary Payton II is launching a professional skateboard league, joining a growing movement of athlete-led leagues aimed at providing year-round relevance to Olympic and action sports.

title: üèà Fantasy football PPR rankings for Week 1
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Is this Naomi Osaka's breakthrough tournament?
content: Naomi Osaka defeated Coco Gauff at the US Open on Monday -- and looked like she was back to Grand Slam-winning form.

title: Let's preview the 2025 NFL season: Bold predictions, strengths and concerns for all 32 teams
content: Here's everything you need to know ahead of the NFL regular season, including how teams rank before Week 1.

title: Simulating the entire season: The biggest storylines from one possible outcome
content: We played out on of the Football Power Index's 10,000 season sims, from Week 1 through Super Bowl LX.

title: Who won and lost the transfer window? Assessing Liverpool, Arsenal, Man United, more
content: This summer transfer window broke more records, with last season's Premier League champions doing an astonishing amount of business to remain ahead of the pack. Here are our winners and losers.

title: Welcome to September! Ranking the MLB playoff races that will rule the final month
content: Here's what you need to know about the battles to reach October as teams trying to lock up a postseason spot.

title: Basketball Hall of Fame: Where the 2025 class stacks up for NBA, WNBA
content: Ahead of enshrinement weekend, let's take a closer look at where this year's class ranks in both leagues.

title: Solak: The Packers needed Micah Parsons -- and here's how they should use him
content: Parsons could take Green Bay's defense to another level. Let's look at how he fits into Jeff Hafley's scheme.

title: One year post-shooting, San Francisco's Ricky Pearsall has grown on and off the field
content: The WR was shot in the chest a week before his rookie season, but now he's putting "a positive light" on it.

title: Only in college football: Week 1's best non-statistical superlatives
content: From USF's trickery and Tommy Castellanos' last laugh to Taylor Swift cheering on Travis Kelce's Bearcats, Week 1 had highlights beyond the box score.

title: Liverpool and Arsenal look incomplete, Fulham VAR drama, Real Madrid win again, more
content: Liverpool and Arsenal wasn't a classic by any means as both teams clearly need to figure things out. "Works in progress" was a recurring theme as Marcotti recaps the weekend

title: MLS Power Rankings: Philadelphia jumps San Diego into top spot
content: Philadelphia Union's statement win over Cincinnati has the Union back on top of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: 'The Rich Eisen Show' on ESPN: How to listen and watch
content: 'The Rich Eisen Show' is joining forces with ESPN platforms! Find out how to get your weekday dose of pop culture and sports now.

title: Mike Clay's Playbook, Part 3: How to manage your team post-draft
content: The draft is just the beginning. Mike Clay gives you a guide to being a championship-winning manager.

title: Clay makes his NFL season forecast: Picking the best offenses, top defenses and Super Bowl winner
content: Let's project the NFL's best -- and worst -- offenses and defenses. Plus, how do all 32 teams rank overall, and who will make the Super Bowl?

title: Guide to the rookie class: Who is flying under the radar? Who will win OROY, DROY?
content: Here's everything you need to know about this group of first-years, including Rookie of the Year front-runners.

title: WWE Clash in Paris results: Rollins keeps title, holds off Uso, Punk and Knight
content: Seth Rollins retained the World Heavyweight Championship against Jey Uso, CM Punk, and LA Knight, while John Cena beat Logan Paul at WWE Clash in Paris.

title: Canelo vs. Crawford: 10 big fights that define their careers
content: A look at both fighters' best performance, best KO, most dominant fight, the one where they struggled and more.

title: What is the Ryder Cup? 2025 format, teams, all-time winners
content: The 45th edition of the Ryder Cup will take place in September 2025. Check out details on the dates, format, teams, all-time winners and more now.

title: Ramos, Olise join pantheon of singing soccer stars
content: It's been a wild few days in football -- not in terms of rumbling transfer sagas, VAR-related controversies or eyebrow-raising results, but in terms of a surprising amount of new music being released by active players.

title: Lee Corso's farewell to 'GameDay': Behind the scenes of a football celebrationÔªø
content: Fans, many without tickets to the game, came from all over the country to Columbus to get a glimpse of Corso one last time.

title: Weekly pickups: Jonah Tong, Payton Tolle lead fantasy playoff picks
content: The players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers to help you in the fantasy playoffs.

title: Amid tariff tensions, US & India kick off largest-ever Army exercise in Alaska
content: Despite tariff tensions, India and the US commenced the 'Yudh Abhyas' Army exercise in Alaska. Planning is underway for the Malabar naval exercise with Quad nations off Guam. Defence cooperation remains strong, with ongoing deliveries of GE engines and a future deal for MQ-9B drones, highlighting the enduring strategic partnership.

title: ‚ÄòWill get this solved‚Äô: Trump aide trade talks with India; calls SCO meeting ‚Äòlargely performative‚Äô
content: Amid escalating attacks on Ukraine, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent indicated that all options are on the table, including further sanctions against Russia. He downplayed the significance of the SCO summit and criticized India's purchase and resale of Russian oil, accusing them of financing the war.

title: Riding out American storm: Modi joins Putin in his limo; seeks early end to Ukraine conflict
content: Despite US pressure, India and Russia reaffirmed their strong ties at the SCO summit, with PM Modi and President Putin emphasizing their nations' enduring friendship and cooperation. Modi highlighted the importance of their partnership for global stability, while Putin noted the positive momentum in trade and economic relations.

title: Moment marketing: Indian firms ride Trump's tariff wave; witty ads target US rivals
content: Fueled by Trump's tariffs, a 'swadeshi' wave sweeps India, with brands like Amul and Dabur championing local products through patriotic campaigns. While some experts see it as opportunism, others believe it resonates in smaller towns. Despite the sentiment, consumers prioritize value, questioning if nationalism alone can drive purchasing decisions as brands strategically tap into the 'vocal for local' trend.

title: Aadhaar can't be standalone proof of citizenship, says SC
content: The Supreme Court has declined to direct the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar as sole proof of citizenship for Bihar voter list enrollment, emphasizing its legal limitations. Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi reiterated that Aadhaar remains an identity document, not a citizenship proof, aligning with the Aadhaar Act and the Puttaswamy judgment.

title: Old clip resurfaces: Gates mocked for internet vision; Letterman jokes go viral
content: In a resurfaced 1995 interview, Bill Gates faced laughter on The Late Show with David Letterman while explaining the internet's potential. Gates described features like online publishing, email, and niche communities, met with skepticism and jokes. The clip now highlights the contrast between initial disbelief and the internet's current ubiquitous role.

title: Bengaluru traffic: Infosys reschedules bus service; commute clashed with US calls
content: Infosys has adjusted its evening bus schedule from its Electronic City facility in Bengaluru, effective September 1, to address employee concerns about lengthy commutes impacting productivity and client interactions with US counterparts.

title: Wedding bells for Haliburton? Fianc√©e Jade teases venue; fans flood Instagram with love
content: Jade Jones, fianc√©e of NBA star Tyrese Haliburton, has ignited wedding speculation by sharing glimpses of her dress and venue selection on social media. The couple, engaged since July 2025 after dating for six years, met at Iowa State University. Jones' recent posts, including a photo in a white dress and a venue reveal, hint at their upcoming nuptials.

title: Rain, landslides batter Himachal, 5 more killed; monsoon toll over 300
content: Heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh triggered landslides, resulting in at least five fatalities and widespread disruption. Over 1,200 roads are blocked, including key highways, and power and water supplies are severely affected. The state has recorded its highest rainfall in August since 1949, exacerbating the challenges faced by residents and rescue efforts.

title: AI restructure at Meta: Wang‚Äôs memo to staff makes one thing clear - all report to him
content: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intensifying the AI race by reorganizing Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) into four specialized teams under Alexandr Wang's leadership. This restructuring aims to accelerate the pursuit of "personal superintelligence," consolidating research, product development, and infrastructure efforts. Key leaders like Nat Friedman and Aparna Ramani will play crucial roles in this ambitious endeavor.

title: Why are minority institutions left out of RTE, asks SC
content: The Supreme Court has expressed serious reservations about its 2014 verdict, which exempted minority educational institutions from the Right to Education (RTE) Act. The court fears this exemption undermines universal elementary education and inclusivity.

title: Former live-in partner burns woman to death on street in Bengaluru
content: In a shocking incident in Bengaluru, Vanajakshi was burned alive by her former live-in partner, Vittal, due to jealousy over her relationships. The victim succumbed to her injuries in the hospital, leaving behind a young son. In a separate incident, a man was arrested for allegedly abetting his wife's suicide, following accusations of dowry harassment and infidelity.

title: How rich is Bill Belichick? Breaking down his NFL career earnings
content: Bill Belichick, renowned for his NFL coaching success and six Super Bowl wins with the Patriots, boasts an estimated net worth of $70 million. His recent move to North Carolina involves a five-year contract worth $10 million annually, supplemented by endorsements and real estate investments across the country, solidifying his financial legacy.

title: Parenting choice: Melinda Gates on picking her daughter‚Äôs school
content: Melinda French Gates revealed that Bill Gates, despite his demanding role as Microsoft CEO, made time to drive their eldest daughter to preschool daily. This decision, initially a family negotiation, surprisingly inspired other parents to share domestic responsibilities more equitably. The car rides became cherished moments for Bill and his children, highlighting the importance of balancing work and family.

title: 'Upper caste firms profiting from Russian oil': Udit Raj backs Navarro; row intensifies
content: Congress leader Udit Raj endorsed Peter Navarro's controversial remarks about Brahmins, sparking outrage. He claimed upper castes dominate Indian oil refining and benefit from cheap Russian oil, aligning with his party's focus on non-upper caste coalitions. Karti Chidambaram referenced 'Boston Brahmins' as societal elites, highlighting the complex intersection of caste, politics, and discrimination.

title: Dhankhar vacates VP Enclave, shifts to Abhay Chautala's farmhouse
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar, the former vice-president, has vacated VP Enclave and temporarily moved to a farmhouse in Chhatarpur owned by INLD chief Abhay Chautala, citing old family ties. The VP Enclave will be prepared for Dhankhar's successor, while the process to identify a retirement home for Dhankhar is underway, involving shortlisting and renovation of a suitable bungalow.

title: PM Modi in China: Ties reset with Xi, carpool with Putin, message for Pak - 10 takeaways
content: Prime Minister Modi concluded his China visit, attending the SCO Summit and engaging in key bilateral meetings with Presidents Xi and Putin. Modi emphasized cooperation with China for global welfare and unity against terrorism, subtly criticizing Pakistan and China's BRI. The SCO condemned the Pahalgam attack, and Modi invited Putin to India for the annual summit, strengthening the strategic partnership.

title: George Pickens: Micah Parsons‚Äô Packers trade was ‚Äògood for me‚Äô
content: In a stunning NFL trade, the Dallas Cowboys sent star edge rusher Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers for two first-round picks and Kenny Clark. Parsons promptly signed a record-breaking $188 million extension with Green Bay, becoming the highest-paid non-quarterback.

title: Shedeur Sanders‚Äô private message to Deion after loss inspires
content: Colorado Buffaloes faced a narrow defeat against Georgia Tech. The defense struggled, giving up significant rushing yards. Coach Deion Sanders remained optimistic despite the setback. His son, Shedeur Sanders, sent a rallying cry to the family. He emphasized the need to regroup and uphold the Sanders legacy. Colorado prepares to face Nebraska next.

title: Jack Brady skips Gisele for special outing with mom Bridget Moynahan
content: Bridget Moynahan and her son Jack were spotted at the US Open, continuing their tradition at Arthur Ashe Stadium. This appearance followed Tom Brady's heartfelt social media tribute to Jack on his 18th birthday, highlighting their strong father-son bond. Despite Brady and Moynahan's past relationship, they maintain a respectful co-parenting dynamic, prioritizing their children's well-being.

title: 'Thousands still trapped under rubble': Eyewitnesses describe Afghanistan earthquake horror
content: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, resulting in at least 812 fatalities and nearly 3,000 injuries. Entire villages were flattened, leaving thousands trapped and survivors recounting scenes of chaos and devastation. Rescue efforts are hampered by blocked roads and the remoteness of affected areas, while international aid begins to arrive to support the victims.

title: Aliens illegally entering India to face 5 years' jail & fine up to Rs 5 lakh
content: India's new Immigration & Foreigners Act, 2025, effective September 1, consolidates four existing laws. Entering India without valid documents now carries a penalty of up to five years' imprisonment and a Rs 5 lakh fine. Forged documents lead to harsher penalties. Educational and medical institutions must report foreign nationals' details.

title: SCO meet: How Modi, Putin, Xi flipped Trump's tariff gambit - 'reverse Nixon'?
content: At a Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit, leaders from India, China, and Russia displayed a united front, potentially undermining Washington's influence. This convergence, highlighted by warm interactions and strategic agreements, signals a shift in global power dynamics. Putin's strategic positioning aims to strengthen ties with both Beijing and New Delhi, challenging the US's Cold War strategy.

title: Army removes TMC stage: Mamata sees red; BJP says Bengal CM 'frustrated'
content: The Army dismantled a Trinamool Congress stage in Kolkata's Maidan, citing a violation of permit regulations regarding the duration of events in the area. Mamata Banerjee criticized the BJP, accusing them of using the Army, while urging the forces to remain neutral. TMC alleges political targeting and plans to relocate the protest.

title: Shah tours flood-hit Jammu, assures assistance from Centre
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah assessed flood damage in Jammu, assuring full central support and prompt relief efforts. He highlighted the crucial role of the Army and security forces in rescue operations. An immediate allocation of ‚Çπ209 crore was made to the SDRF, with further assessment and assistance forthcoming after MHA surveys. Vaishno Devi pilgrimage remains suspended due to weather.

title: Clean Mumbai, free occupied areas by noon today, HC orders Jarange
content: The Bombay High Court has directed Maratha quota protesters, led by Jarange, to clear Mumbai's streets by noon, following petitions citing disruptions to city life and violations of fundamental rights. The court's special bench urged Jarange to ensure protesters vacate public spaces, allowing peaceful demonstrations at designated locations after fresh permissions are obtained.

title: Urdu Academy defers Javed Akhtar event after protests
content: The West Bengal Urdu Academy postponed a poetry symposium featuring Javed Akhtar after religious groups protested his invitation, citing that his comments hurt their sentiments. While the Academy cited "unavoidable circumstances," critics suggest yielding to pressure. Akhtar stated he receives criticism from both Hindu and Muslim organizations and remains undeterred, hoping to visit Kolkata soon.

title: The Rock‚Äôs drastic weight loss leaves WWE comeback in serious doubt
content: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson surprises fans with a thinner look at the Venice Film Festival. This transformation is for his role as Mark Kerr in 'The Smashing Machine'. Johnson lost about 60 pounds through diet and workout. Fans react with amusement and concern. Johnson aims to showcase a broader acting range. Prosthetics are used for his transformation into Kerr.

title: BJP MLA‚Äôs brother held over objectionable post on UP CM Yogi
content: Bholendra Pal Singh, brother of BJP MLA Mahendra Pal Singh, has been arrested for posting derogatory remarks against Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and his OSD on social media. Facing multiple FIRs, he was apprehended from a Kushinagar hotel after a manhunt. Police also seized spurious liquor from his brick kiln, initiating further legal action and investigating his associates.

title: Reality check for Trump! Why blame India? US, EU trade with Russia runs in billions
content: Donald Trump has criticized India for its continued oil and arms purchases from Russia, leading to a 25% tariff imposed by the US. Despite this, both the US and EU continue significant trade with Russia, importing billions worth of goods.

title: From debt to empire: Fight game mogul: Dana White turns UFC global; Who is Anne White?
content: Dana White, the UFC president, has built a combat sports empire, amassing a $520 million net worth by 2025. His wealth stems from the UFC's 2016 sale and his ongoing role as president. White also earns from sponsorships, his whiskey brand, and real estate investments, including a lavish Las Vegas compound.

title: India-Russia defence ties: Su-57 fighter jets to be made in India?
content: Amid strengthening ties between India and Russia, Moscow is exploring potential investments to manufacture its Sukhoi Su-57 fifth-generation fighter jets in India. This development occurs as India seeks advanced air defense systems from Russia and navigates trade tensions with the United States, who is also offering its F-35 fighter jets.

title: Vote 'chori', makhana & 'gamcha': Decoding 16 days of Rahul's Bihar yatra - key points
content: Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar, a 16-day campaign across 25 districts, aimed to protect voters' rights. Gandhi alleged that the BJP and Election Commission disenfranchised 65 lakh voters. The yatra, joined by INDIA bloc leaders, showcased opposition unity. It concluded in Patna, framing the campaign as a fight for electoral justice.

title: Pure carnage! 7 sixes in 8 balls: Kieron Pollard's astonishing assault on bowlers
content: Kieron Pollard, at 38, showcased his explosive batting prowess in the Caribbean Premier League, reminding everyone of his destructive capabilities. After a slow start, he unleashed a brutal assault, smashing seven sixes in eight balls against St Kitts and Nevis Patriots.

title: Legacy of Gaudreau: Modest start with candy rewards; fans mourn loss
content: The hockey world mourns the loss of Johnny Gaudreau, fondly called 'Johnny Hockey'. His journey began with Skittles on the ice, thanks to his father. Gaudreau's talent shone at Boston College and in the NHL. He played for the Calgary Flames and Columbus Blue Jackets. His career highlights include All-Star appearances.

title: One-sided picture: Trade with India a 'one-sided' disaster, says Trump
content: Donald Trump called trade with India a disaster. Analysts criticized his approach, saying it pushes India towards China and Russia. Trump complained about trade imbalance and India buying oil from Russia. US media reported on warm interactions between Narendra Modi, Xi Jinping, and Vladimir Putin. Despite this, the US State Department says the US-India partnership remains important.

title: Leaking flyover; flooded streets: Rain cripples Delhi-NCR; 10 videos show chaos
content: Delhi-NCR experienced heavy rainfall and gusty winds on Monday, providing respite from the heat but causing significant disruptions. Waterlogging and traffic jams plagued the region, with rising Yamuna levels prompting flood alerts and the closure of the Old Railway Bridge. Commuters faced severe congestion, and travel advisories were issued by airlines.

title: SC dismisses plea against E20 petrol policy: What it means - and other important FAQs
content: The Supreme Court has greenlit the nationwide rollout of E20 petrol by 2025, dismissing concerns about compatibility with older vehicles. The court sided with the government's argument that E20 supports sugarcane farmers, reduces emissions, and decreases reliance on fossil fuels. While newer vehicles are E20-ready, older models might experience reduced fuel efficiency and potential wear.

title: 18-year-old Pranav V strikes again! 2025 World Jr Champion clinches Fujairah title
content: Pranav Venkatesh triumphed in the Superstars section of the Fujairah Global Chess 2025, held in UAE. He secured victory with an aggressive final-round win, finishing with 7.0/9 points. Prior to this, the 2025 World Junior Champion earned a spot in the FIDE Grand Swiss by winning the "Asian Wildcard Match"Z against GM Kazybek Nogerbek.

title: 'Brahmins profiteering': Trump adviser's remark on Russian oil trade sparks outrage
content: White House trade counselor Peter Navarro ignited controversy by accusing "Brahmins" of profiting from refined Russian oil sales to the West, escalating US-India trade tensions. His remarks, following accusations of India being a "laundromat for Kremlin," sparked outrage and were deemed inflammatory.

title: Asia Cup: Goals galore in Bihar! India humiliate Kazakhstan 15-0
content: India stormed into the Asia Cup Super 4s with a dominant 15-0 victory over Kazakhstan, marking their third consecutive win. Abhishek's four goals led the charge, supported by hat-tricks from Sukhjeet Singh and Jugraj Singh. China also advanced from Pool A, while Malaysia and Korea progressed from Pool B.

title: US ends visa interview waivers from Sept 2; Is India spared from toughest restrictions?
content: Starting September 2, 2025, the US State Department will require in-person interviews for nearly all non-immigrant visa applicants, ending many age-based exemptions and renewal waivers. This change affects students, professionals, and frequent travelers, potentially leading to longer wait times for appointments. Nationals from specific countries face immediate interview requirements, and stricter rescheduling policies will be enforced.

title: Trump rattled? US tries to cosy up to India as PM Modi meets Putin, Xi
content: The US Embassy in India affirmed the strong US-India ties, highlighting it as a defining relationship of the 21st century. Despite this positive outlook, trade tensions persist due to recent tariffs imposed by the US, citing trade deficits and India's Russian oil purchases.

title: Hitman! Rohit Sharma's chat with physio goes viral: 'Ajao chhod deta hu tumko':
content: Rohit Sharma, India's ODI captain, was recently filmed in a light-hearted video with the team physiotherapist after undergoing a fitness test in Bengaluru alongside Jasprit Bumrah and Shubman Gill. Having retired from Test cricket, Rohit is set to play for India A against Australia A in Kanpur as preparation for the upcoming ODI tour of Australia in October.

title: Gurgaon flooded: NH-48 traffic crawls for hours; more showers likely in next 2 days
content: Gurgaon was hit by torrential rain on Monday, causing widespread flooding and traffic chaos. Several areas were submerged, with waterlogging reaching up to three feet in depth. Commuters faced severe delays, and the IMD has issued alerts for more heavy showers.

title: What happened when Queen Camilla faced a creep; new book reveals
content: Queen Camilla's past bravery resurfaces in Valentine Low's new book, revealing how she defended herself against a sexual assault on a train as a teenager. She struck her attacker with her shoe, leading to his arrest.

title: NFL star Russell Wilson and wife turn US Open into a family celebration
content: Ciara and Russell Wilson charmed onlookers at the US Open, blending family time with superstar glamour. Their children, Future Zahir and Sienna Princess, added to the heartwarming scene. Beyond the courts, their Why Not You Foundation hosted a fundraiser at MetLife Stadium, aiming to raise $3 million for youth and families.

title: 2020 riots: Delhi High Court to pass order on bail pleas of Sharjeel Imam, Umar Khalid, others
content: Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam and several others have been booked under UAPA for allegedly being the ‚Äúmasterminds‚Äù of the February 2020 riots in Delhi

title: Tripura Minister labels news media as an obstacle for Panchayat representatives
content: The Minister urged the Panchayat representatives to dedicate some time for the organisational activities of the BJP alongside their regular work

title: Army contingent departs for India-U.S. joint military exercise ‚ÄòYudh Abhyas 2025‚Äô in Alaska
content: The Indian contingent, comprising troops from a battalion of the Madras Regiment, will train alongside soldiers of the 1st Battalion, 5th Infantry Regiment ‚ÄúBobcats‚Äù, part of the Arctic Wolves Brigade Combat Team of the U.S. Army‚Äôs 11th Airborne Division

title: Rajasthan Assembly‚Äôs Monsoon Session starts with uproarious scenes
content: As soon as the House assembled, the Congress members started shouting slogans and displayed placards against vote theft allegations

title: J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar highly vulnerable to glacial lake bursts: report
content: Key public infrastructure including roads, schools and government buildings were at risk, the report highlighted; the district has the highest number of glacial lakes in the Union Territory.¬†

title: Govt. launches ‚ÄòAdi Vaani‚Äô to translate Adivasi languages
content: The government said that while the app is currently equipped to translate four languages ‚Äì Gondi, Bhili, Mundari and Santali

title: Over 3 lakh acres of land hit by flood in Haryana; Faridabad on edge after release of excess water in Yamuna
content: Over 46,880 farmers in 1,003 villages have registered on the e-Kshatipurti portal for crop damage claims

title: Kochi sees significant surge in NDPS cases, seizures
content: Over 300 kg of ganja, nearly 3 kg of MDMA seized in eight months; drugs flow into city in large quantities

title: School in Kochi revises rules, to fine parents for late arrival of students
content: According to the revised rules, a child will no longer be punished or miss classes for arriving late. Instead, the onus has been placed on parents, who may now face a fine for bringing their wards late to schoo

title: ‚ÄòMillennium City‚Äô ramps up civic response after outcry over crippling infrastructure
content: A two-day rain-induced deluge in July sparked public fury in Gurugram, prompting the city‚Äôs municipal corporation to launch a drive targeting waterlogging, waste management, and other civic issues

title: Immigration bureau set to check fraud, deport foreigners
content: The Rules to govern the Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025, notified by the MHA on Monday (September 1, 2025), allow for recording biometric data of foreigners and mandate educational institutions to inform the BOI about foreign students. Clubs and resorts can be shut down if frequented by illegal migrants or foreigners with criminal record

title: Congress MP Sasikanth Senthil withdraws hunger strike temporarily
content: Congress top brass appealed to give up the hunger strike, Mr. Senthil says; he was protesting against the Centre over Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan funds for Tamil Nadu

title: Incessant rain and flood disrupt life in northern India
content: Punjab Governor to visit flood-affected districts from tomorrow; entire Himachal State declared as disaster hit; heavy rainfall warning issued for Haryana; precautionary measures ramped up in Chandigarh

title: Will accept Bihar SIR claims until last date of nominations: Election Commission of India
content: Earlier in the day in Supreme Court, the poll panel submitted it would accept revision forms even after the deadline, and these would be integrated into the final list

title: Amit Shah takes stock of rain-inflicted damage in Jammu and Kashmir, promises help
content: Home Minister calls for strengthening early warning systems to reduce the impact of natural calamities; teams from Ministry of Home Affairs and union territory administration should prioritise damage assessment and a meeting of relevant departments will be held soon, he says

title: Maratha quota protest: Maharashtra government to act against ‚Äòanti-social elements‚Äô
content: ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt say that law and order has collapsed. Within half an hour, police cleared the roads,‚Äù Chief Minister Devenra Fadnavis said.

title: New orchid recorded in Arunachal Pradesh
content: The Gastrochilus pechei has underlined the floral link between the State and Myanmar, the researchers said

title: Uttarakhand reserves 10% jobs for retired Agniveers in uniformed posts
content: The Cabinet had approved the proposal for reservation for Agniveers in State government jobs last month

title: Prime suspect in murder of 18-year-old arrested in Uttar Pradesh
content: Ishita Mallick was shot in her home in front of her family on the afternoon of August 25. While the details of the motive and the nature of the crime are still pending interrogation, the police said that a relationship feud may have been one of the possible motives

title: Nagaland University to develop grammar for 18 Naga languages
content: Naga tongues have been taught in schools for decades, but none have a dedicated written grammar for the teaching-learning process

title: Supreme Court seeks response to transgender-inclusive sex education plea
content: The petition seeks the formal integration of age-appropriate, transgender-inclusive comprehensive sexuality education (CSE) into school curricula nationwide

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Centre after T.N. says Samagra Shiksha funds delinked from RTE reimbursements
content: Tamil Nadu submitted that the Centre and State had concurrent responsibility to fund the education of poor and disadvantaged children under Section 7 of the RTE Act, 2009

title: Can minority-run schools be exempted from RTE law, SC refers question to larger Bench
content: A Constitution Bench, in 2014, held that the RTE law violated the minority character of these institutions and took the institutions entirely out of the ambit of the law. On Monday, Justice Datta observed that the 2014 judgment has ‚Äòunknowingly jeopardised the very foundation of universal elementary education‚Äô

title: Congress resolves to ensure Mamkootathil‚Äôs attendance as an ‚Äòunattached member‚Äô in Kerala Assembly
content: DYFI State president V.K. Sanoj reaffirms the Left youth organisation‚Äôs determination to deter  Mamkootathil from attending the House

title: CM inaugurates projects worth over ‚Çπ180 crore at Thiruvananthapuram MCH
content: Pinarayi Vijayan flags the recent trend of corporate takeover of private hospitals as it leads to significant escalation in treatment costs.

title: There‚Äôs no problem if Muslims accept Indian culture, laws: Assam CM
content: On the sidelines of an official event in southern Assam‚Äôs Sribhumi, Himanta Biswa Sarma said people living in Barak Valley listening to Bangladesh radio channels was unacceptable

title: Phones fall silent, fears rise as Afghans in Delhi await news from quake-hit homeland
content: At least 812 people were killed and over 2,500 injured when the 6.0 magnitude quake struck towns in Kunar province in Nangarhar; the tragedy has left many Afghans here consumed with fear about the fate of their loved ones.

title: Two workers killed, 20 injured as blast triggers fire at textile unit in Gujarat
content: The incident occurred at Santosh Textile Mill in Jolva village in the afternoon after a chemical drum exploded

title: Crime Branch records statement of third-party complainant in probe against Rahul Mamkootathil
content: The complainant, Lawyer Shinto Sebastian, who had, quoting an anonymous voice clip, accused the Palakkad MLS of ‚Äúcoercing a victim‚Äù to terminate her pregnancy at the peril of her life, says he has submitted the ‚Äúevidence‚Äù to investigators

title: 11-member committee to investigate elephant deaths
content: Repeated instances of elephant carcasses being found in a river in the Malayattoor Forest Division spark demand for investigation

title: Andhra Pradesh launches Swachha Andhra Awards, first State to honour excellence in cleanliness
content: Andhra Pradesh will present annual awards at State and district levels to recognise excellence in sanitation across institutions, communities, and individuals, with the first ceremony scheduled for October 2, 2025, on Mahatma Gandhi‚Äôs birth anniversary, says official

title: HC restrains police from arresting bodybuilder till Sept. 12
content: As per the FIR, the bodybuilder allegedly trespassed into the gym, which he had leased out to a woman, and stole over ‚Çπ10,000 and some documents

title: KTR says CBI probe on Kaleshwaram Barrages is conspiracy against Telangana
content: He alleges that it‚Äôs a plot hatched by Revanth Reddy, Naidu, Modi; Party calls for protests across the State

title: Karnataka High Court refuses to quash chargesheet against ‚Äòkingpin‚Äô in Valmiki corporation fraud case
content: The High Court of Karnataka on Monday refused to quash a criminal case against G. Satyanarayana Varma, a Hyderabad-based civil contractor, who has been described as ‚Äòkingpin‚Äô in the case involving misappropriation of over ‚Çπ89 crore of the Karnataka Maharshi Valmiki Scheduled Tribes Development Corporation Ltd

title: Higher secondary teachers will boycott clerical duties from September 5: AHSTA
content: AHSTA says making teachers do clerical and office work instead of focussing on teaching is an injustice to students

title: Convicts are entitled for remission even if sentence imposed is for specified term: Karnataka High Court
content: Convicts are entitled to being considered for remission even if the sentence is beyond 20 years or for a specified term, unless the order of sentence makes it clear that the convict shall not be entitled for premature release or remission or parole or the like, said the High Court of Karnataka

title: Inquiry points to intelligence failure in Keezhara blast
content: Despite six cases against Anoop Malik, the main accused, relating to illegal collection and manufacturing of firecrackers, the intelligence wing of the police has failed to identify his involvement in manufacturing and selling gunpowder

title: YSRCP leaders allege several irregularities in Kavali constituency
content: MLAs of coalition parties are involved in corruption and illegal mining, alleges party‚Äôs Nellore district   president Kakani Govardhan Reddy

title: West Bengal doctors‚Äô group demands ‚Äòdismissal of vindictive cases‚Äô against protesting medics
content: In a letter to the Kolkata Police Commissioner, the Joint Platform of Doctors, West Bengal, alleges that the police keep sending summons to doctors ‚Äòciting some trivial insignificant issues related with democratic protests‚Äô. Agitations were held across the State against the rape and murder of a doctor at RGKMCH on August 9 last year

title: This August, Kerala witnessed a sedate monsoon
content: After 2018 and 2019, when the State received extreme rainfall in August, leading to major floods, rain has been more or less on normal lines during the month. This August, the State received 355.8 mm of rain against the average of 445.2 mm, a shortfall of 20%

title: Barrages used as dams: report points to rampant, brazen irregularities
content: In its 665-page report, which was tabled and discussed in the Assembly on Sunday, the Justice P.C. Ghose Commission of Inquiry  stated that all the decisions pertaining to the three barrages were taken by the then Chief Minister K. Chandrasekhar Rao

title: Indian Navy ships conclude Jeddah visit with joint naval exercise
content: During the visit, the ships engaged extensively with the RSNF and Saudi Border Guard through sports fixtures and interactions with personnel.

title: Basava Samskriti Abhiyan to enter Yadgir on Thursday
content: Organised by the Lingayat Mathadhipathigala Okkoota, it will mark the first anniversary of Basavanna being declared cultural icon of the State

title: IRDAI official held in ‚Çπ5.30 crore fund diversion case
content: To clear his debts, the officer devised a scheme to divert IRDAI funds by fabricating invoices, office notes, quotations and other documents, which he pushed through for approval from senior officials.

title: Tourists visit hill stations in Chikkamagaluru after booking slots online
content: Chikkamagaluru district administration has restricted the number of vehicles visiting the hill stations in Chikkamagaluru

title: Assault on YouTuber Shajan Scaria: four taken into custody
content: As per FIR, the accused blocked the vehicle in which Shajan was travelling, manhandled him, and attempted to murder him

title: India Sends Humanitarian Aid To Afghanistan After Massive Earthquake
content: Following a series of earthquakes that struck eastern Afghanistan, killing over 800 people and injuring over 2800, India has extended urgent humanitarian assistance to support relief efforts in the region.

title: Mob Burns Nigerian Woman To Death Over Alleged Blasphemy Claim: Police
content: A mob burnt a woman to death in central Nigeria over the weekend after accusing her of blasphemy against Islam, police said Monday.

title: Nicolas Maduro Vows To Declare "Republic In Arms" If US Attacks Venezuela
content: Venezuelan President Nicols Maduro on Monday said he "would constitutionally declare a republic in arms" if the South American country were attacked by forces that the United States government has deployed to the Caribbean.

title: Nestle Sacks CEO Over "Romantic Relationship" In Office
content: Swiss food giant Nestle on Monday dismissed Laurent Freixe as chief executive with immediate effect over an "undisclosed romantic relationship with a direct subordinate".

title: "Did You Ever See Me Taking Leave?": Chandrababu Naidu On 30 Years As Chief Minister
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu said on Monday that he never took even a day's leave in his political career and has been working like a machine every day for the people's welfare.

title: Cleaner Air, Yamuna's Revival: What Delhi's Climate Plan Means For You
content: At a review meeting on Monday, Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa went over the city's revised State Action Plan on Climate Change, setting targets for 2050 across nine key sectors

title: Chinese Mining Company Accused Covering Up Major Toxic Spill In Zambia
content: A Chinese-owned mining company has been accused of covering up the extent of a disastrous toxic spill in Zambia that polluted a major river that millions rely on with cyanide and arsenic.

title: PM Modi China Visit Highlights: PM Modi, Putin Hold 45-Minute Meeting After SCO Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday attended the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Tianjin, China, and called upon member countries to take firm and decisive action to fight terrorism.

title: "It's Getting Late": Trump Claims India "Offered To Cut Tariffs To Nothing"
content: US President Donald Trump claimed Monday that India has offered to reduce its tariffs on US goods to zero, underlining that New Delhi should have done it years ago.

title: Robert F Kennedy Jr 'Endangering' All Americans, Health Agency Ex-Chiefs Warn
content: Nine former leaders of the top US health body sounded the alarm Monday about the Trump administration's evisceration of the agency and warned that vaccine skeptic Robert F. Kennedy Jr is "endangering every American's health."

title: Ukraine's Children Start New School Year In Underground Classrooms To Avoid Russian Bombs
content: Pupils were returning to schools in Ukraine on Monday for the start of the new academic year in the hope of being able to study safely under the shadow of Russia's invasion.

title: Woman Thrashed, Paraded Around Jharkhand Village With Garland Of Slippers
content: A woman was thrashed, her hair cut, and then she was paraded around the village in a half-naked state with a garland of slippers slung around her neck, shows a disturbing video from Jharkhand.

title: What To Know About Indonesia's Nationwide Unrest Over Lawmakers' Perks
content: The wave of violent protests that have swept across Indonesia and left seven people dead is being seen as a major test for President Prabowo Subianto.

title: Ex-Columbia University President Minouche Shafik Tapped As UK Economic Adviser
content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer on Monday appointed economist and former Columbia University president Minouche Shafik as his chief economic adviser.

title: Amid Maratha Quota Stir Traffic Chaos, Judge Walks To Reach High Court
content: Not only common people, but even the Bombay High Court was inconvenienced by Maratha quota protesters who occupied streets in south Mumbai and blocked a car of a judge, who had to walk a short distance to reach the HC building.

title: New Immigration & Foreigners Act Comes Into Effect, Severe Punishment For Forging Passport, Visa
content: A new Act that regulates matters related to foreigners and immigration and has provisions for heavy punishment for carrying a forged passport or visa came into effect on Monday.

title: Weather Department Forecasts Rain In West Bengal Ahead Of Durga Puja
content: The Meteorological Department has forecast spells of rain in Kolkata and several districts of south Bengal in the run-up to Durga Puja, the state's biggest festival.

title: North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un Departs for Rare China Trip: Report
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un departed Pyongyang for Beijing on Monday afternoon to attend a military parade marking the end of World War II, a rare overseas visit that will underscore his ties with both China and Russia

title: PM Modi's Tax Overhaul Cuts Levies On Shampoos, Hybrid Cars, And TVs
content: India plans to cut consumption tax by at least 10 percentage points on nearly 175 products ranging from shampoos and hybrid cars to consumer electronics, said two sources, revealing new details of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's major tax overhaul.

title: Artificial Ponds: Delhi's Answer To Yamuna Pollution After Idol Immersion
content: As Ganesh Chaturthi 2025 celebrations begin and Durga Puja approaches, the Delhi government is preparing to manage one of the city's biggest environmental challenges: idol immersion.

title: Weekly pickups: Lacan finishing the season strong
content: the longest regular season in WNBA history concludes next week . there is value in identifying strong finishers around the league . a rising rookie featured in the backcourt section below could be a top fantasy force .

title: Son's LAFC arrival brings out pride in L.A.'s Korean community
content: Son Heung-Min welcomes son to your new home . despite a tense 2-1 loss to San Diego FC, the result felt secondary to the raucous festivities . the south Korean forward represents much more than just a player on the pitch .

title: 'No days off': Inside the pillars of Patriots' Mike Vrabel's hands-on coaching style
content: a former linebacker who became a head coach emerged with a bloody cut on his cheek . he was hired as the 16th head coach in the Patriots history in january . the former nfl player was tangled up with an defender on the ground during a practice .

title: Rating the new attacking signings: Sesko, Pedro, Gy√∂keres, more
